I was quite confused by the stacktrace, it took me a while to realize what is going on: `io.netty.util.internal.logging.Log4J2Logger` is a subclass(!) of `org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.ExtendedLoggerWrapper`.  

The Netty logging abstraction (`io.netty.util.internal.logging.InternalLogger`) has methods such as `debug(String format, Object arg)`. This method happens to be implemented by `o.a.l.l.s.ExtendedLoggerWrapper` (or its superclass), but only in newer log4j2 versions. When an old version of log4j2 is available in runtime then calling `internalLogger.debug(string, o)` throws the `AbstractMethodError`.

issue.title: Do not fail on runtime when an older version of Log4J2 is on the clas…

issue.body:
…spath.

Motivation:

At the moment we will just assume the correct version of log4j2 is used when we find it on the classpath. This may lead to an AbstractMethodError at runtime.

Modifications:

Let Log4J2Logger extend AbstractInternalLogger and check on class loading if we need to take special action to delegat to older versions of Log4J2.

Result:

Fixes https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/8217.

body:
hi @normanmaurer, I tried #8240 and I can confirm the test passes and Netty fallbacks to j.u.l. 

This effectively means it's impossible to use Netty with Log4j2 on Java 6. That's not great for embedded use-cases. From this perspective the #8239 is nicer. 

I understand if you do not want to to pollute log4j2 logger with the branching for the sake of Java 6. Perhaps it could be a separate logger class. Think of `LegacyLog4J2Logger`. Would you accept a PR with this?

> This effectively means it's impossible to use Netty with Log4j2 on Java 6.

Yes, but that's never worked. I took this issue to be a bug report that Netty breaks (which it shouldn't). But it sounds like you're thinking of this more of a feature request to support log4j2 on Java 6?

> I understand if you do not want to to pollute log4j2 logger with the branching for the sake of Java 6.

I was not as concerned at the branching, but with the "why are we investing this much?" It seemed weird to go so far out of our way to add a new feature to Netty to support a 3-year-dead release (2.4 came out 3 years ago)? I'd understand more if log4j2 still supported Java 6 in some branch, but it doesn't seem to. I'd also understand more if log4j2+Netty+Java 6 was previously supported, but from what I can tell it wasn't. Also, log4j2 has actually received important changes which reduce garbage which make sense for Netty to use. I sort of feel like "log4j2 is not supporting Java 6" is the bug.

That said, the large changes to Log4J2Logger are also present in #8240 so I may have been misattributing some of what is necessary to support older Log4J2 versions.
